Articles.Content: Hi. Does anyone know if it is possible to make engines receive a balance amount of intakeair, so that flameout is symmetric?

No, because the intake air drops below the threshold where the is only enough air for one engine but not enough for two. Therefore, the game decides which engine will cut out and which engine will "stay strong". If you are doing an ssto, I suggest cutting the engines BEFORE flameout to prevent the dreaded mission-ending spinning.

2 hours ago, Benjamin Kerman said:

Therefore, the game decides which engine will cut out and which engine will "stay strong". If you are doing an ssto, I suggest cutting the engines BEFORE flameout to prevent the dreaded mission-ending spinning. 

Thanks..... I was hoping for another answer, but was expecting something like this.
Happy to help, nevertheless!
You can minimize this effect by alternating placement of intakes and air-breathing engines.

I kind of dig that asymmetric flameout happens in KSP, as in real life

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unstart
